channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Wobbly tile on Diameter Road, 8th February
item.description:
There is a wobbly tile on Diameter Road down the side of 79 Rolleston Ave which splashes water up your legs when stepped on after rain. Present for at least 3 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Diameter Road, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular pavement parking, 8th February
item.description:
Local businesses park on prevents regularly unloading goods and blocking the pavements

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Plough Way, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Salt bin in Aberford Gardens, 8th February
item.description:
In Aberford Gardens is a bin container which was put there orginally for salt but over the years people know put their rubbish in it it is disguisting and needs moving as not fit for purpose, many times I have picked up rubbish near it and watch people sitting on it then just throw the bottles or cans in it or near it, the bin needs to go, also can you put up 2 signs on the grass, no ball games as kids play football on it and hit cars and windows and no dogs allowed signs as people let their dogs on it to mess, as I keep saying what has happened to this estate it is just a dumping ground, sorry I keep moaning I just hate to live on a estate with rubbish everywhere, I use to pick up the rubbish with a stick but now have health issues and can not do it any more, As I have said before its not the councils estate its the people who live here
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tellson Avenue, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over spilling on to the pavement and blocking path, 8th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Way, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Uneven paving slabs, 8th February
item.description:
The paving slabs have been uneven (and getting worse) outside 91/89 Weirdale Avenue. I’m worried that someone will trip over them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 146, Weirdale Avenue, Brunswick Park, Greater London

item.title: Illegal street party rubbish, 8th February
item.description:
Street party took place in the arches leaving bbq coals and F&B waste pls remove as not only a mess but now foxes, pigeons and rats feeding off the food waste. Reported to police but regular occurrence which reauires requires street cleansing more regularly as we have a lot of vermin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 197, Hercules Road, Lambeth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pallet, 8th February
item.description:
One of the shopkeepers here clearly gets a pallet of food delivered every week. And he just leaves the pallet on the pavement. Surely it’s easier to track him down than to pick up a pallet every week?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Kent Road, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branches breaking off and falling into garden, 8th February
item.description:
I was told in 2022 that the tree had been pruned (not that I saw this happen) and that they should be every 3 years. Therefore the tree should have been pruned last year which I haven’t seen evidence of. We now have large branches snapping and falling into the garden which is dangerous.. I can see some other branches hanging. I would like the tree to be checked and pruned and branches overhanging my property to be cut back to avoid and accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Allen Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
